lead_paragraph: The Advertising Club of New York presented its 44th annual Andy Awards. The best in show award, known as the Grandy, was presented to the San Francisco office of the McCann Worldgroup and T.A.G., part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, for a campaign to introduce Halo 3 for the Microsoft Xbox video game system. TBWA Worldwide, part of the Omnicom Group, won the most Andys, 18, followed by BBDO Worldwide, also part of Omnicom, with 14, and Leo Burnett, part of the Publicis Groupe, with 10. The Richard T. O’Reilly Award for best of show in public service advertising was presented to Droga5, New York, for a campaign creating the Tap Project, which raises money for safe drinking water on behalf of Unicef.

abstract: Microsoft asked Europe’s second-highest court to overturn or reduce a record fine of 899 million euros ($1.4 billion) from the European Union.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft asked Europe’s second-highest court to overturn or reduce a record fine of 899 million euros ($1.4 billion) from the European Union.

headline.main: Microsoft Appeals $1.4 Billion Fine by Europe

abstract: Yahoo‘s Jerry Yang may be happy that Microsoft has walked away. But plenty of investors in the Internet company he co-founded and runs aren’t.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo‘s Jerry Yang may be happy that Microsoft has walked away. But plenty of investors in the Internet company he co-founded and runs aren’t.
